meanings.definition: Having the ability to withstand or oppose something.
meanings.sent1: The sturdy umbrella was resistant to the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The new fabric is resistant to water, keeping you dry in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn door was resistant to being opened, causing frustration.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fortress, resistant to the doubts that tried to invade.
meanings.sent5: The shield was so resistant, it seemed invincible against any attack.

meanings.definition: Not affected or harmed by something.
meanings.sent1: His skin was resistant to the sunburn, staying unharmed after hours in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The vaccine made her resistant to the flu, keeping her healthy all winter.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit was resistant to bullets, making him feel invincible.
meanings.sent4: She was emotionally resistant to criticism, her confidence unshaken.
meanings.sent5: The ancient armor was resistant to rust, preserving its strength through time.

meanings.sent1: The rebellious teenager was resistant to following rules.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were resistant to the new law, voicing their opposition.
meanings.sent3: The cat was resistant to taking a bath, hissing at the sight of water.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were resistant to his charm, showing no sign of affection.
meanings.sent5: The tree roots were resistant to the shovel, making it hard to dig them out.
